intro: Brassia angustilabia, commonly known as the narrow-lipped orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its elegant, pendulous flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has long, slender stems and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers with narrow lips. It thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth. Brassia angustilabia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in both indoor and greenhouse settings.
